name: JsonDecoder
comment: This class parses JSON strings and builds the corresponding objects.

convert.name: convert
convert.comment:
Converts the given JSON-string dart-convert.JsonDecoder.convert.input to its corresponding object.

Parsed JSON values are of the types dart-core.num, dart-core.String, dart-core.bool, dart-core.Null, dart-core.Lists of parsed JSON values or dart-core.Maps from dart-core.String to parsed JSON values.

If this was initialized with a reviver, then the parsing operation invokes the reviver on every object or list property that has been parsed. The arguments are the property name (dart-core.String) or list index (dart-core.int), and the value is the parsed value. The return value of the reviver is used as the value of that property instead the parsed value.

Throws dart-core.FormatException if the input is not valid JSON text.

startChunkedConversion.name: startChunkedConversion
startChunkedConversion.comment:
Starts a conversion from a chunked JSON string to its corresponding object.

The output dart-convert.JsonDecoder.startChunkedConversion.sink receives exactly one decoded element through add.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides dart-convert.JsonDecoder.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and dart-convert.JsonDecoder.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the dart-convert.JsonDecoder.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
dart-convert.JsonDecoder.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to dart-convert.JsonDecoder.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If dart-convert.JsonDecoder.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of dart-convert.JsonDecoder.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

convert.name: convert
convert.comment: Converts dart-convert.JsonDecoder.convert.input and returns the result of the conversion.

fuse.name: fuse
fuse.comment:
Fuses this with dart-convert.JsonDecoder.fuse.other.

Encoding with the resulting converter is equivalent to converting with this before converting with other.
